intro: Hyaloseris catamaquiensis, commonly known as the Catamangua hyaloseris, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky soils, thriving in cool, humid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
